TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TreeNodeBindingCollection extends System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection
Public NotInheritable Class TreeNodeBindingCollection Inherits StateManagedCollection
public ref class TreeNodeBindingCollection sealed : System::Web::UI::StateManagedCollection

summary.span: 表示 控件中的 对象的集合。

span.span: Represents a collection of objects in the control.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 类用于存储和管理集合的中的对象控件。The class is used to store and manage a collection of objects in the control. 控件使用类其属性。The control uses the class for its property. 属性包含定义数据项和它所绑定到的节点之间的关系的对象。The property contains objects that define the relationship between a data item and the node that it is binding to. 当绑定到数据源的每个数据项都包含 （如具有多个特性的 XML 元素） 的多个属性节点显示返回的值`ToString`的数据项，默认情况下的方法。When binding to a data source where each data item contains multiple properties (such as an XML element with several attributes), a node displays the value that is returned by the `ToString` method of the data item, by default. 对于 XML 元素，节点显示的元素名称，其显示在树的基础结构，但其他方面不是非常有用。In the case of an XML element, the node displays the element name, which shows the underlying structure of the tree but is not very useful otherwise. 可以通过指定的树节点绑定来绑定到特定数据项属性节点。You can bind a node to a specific data item property by specifying tree node bindings. 尽管可以以编程方式填充集合，通常以声明方式设置。Although the collection can be programmatically populated, it is usually set declaratively. 若要设置树节点绑定以声明方式：To set the tree node bindings declaratively: 1. 嵌套开始和结束``开始和结束标记之间的标记控件。Nest opening and closing `` tags between the opening and closing tags of the control. 2. 位置``元素开始标记和结束之间``你想要指定每个树节点绑定的标记。Place `` elements between the opening and closing `` tags for each tree node binding that you want to specify. 你可以以编程方式管理通过添加和删除对象。You can programmatically manage a by adding and removing objects. 若要添加对象添加到收藏，使用或方法。To add a object to the collection, use the or method. 若要从集合中删除节点，使用， ，或方法。To remove nodes from the collection, use the , , or method. 类支持多种方法可访问集合中的项：The class supports several ways to access the items in the collection: - 使用索引器以检索直接在特定的从零开始索引的对象。Use the indexer to retrieve a object directly at a specific zero-based index. - 使用方法来创建可用于循环访问集合的枚举。Use the method to create an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection. ## Examples 本部分包含两个代码示例。This section contains two code examples. 第一个代码示例演示如何填充对象以声明方式。The first code example demonstrates how to populate a object declaratively. 第二个代码示例演示如何填充对象以编程方式。The second code example demonstrates how to populate a object programmatically. 下面的代码示例演示如何填充对象以声明方式。The following code example demonstrates how to populate a object declaratively. 对于此示例中正常工作，你必须复制位于到名为 Book.xml 本节末尾的 XML 数据。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. [!code-aspx-csharp[TreeViewXml#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewXml/CS/treeviewxmlcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeViewXml#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewXml/VB/treeviewxmlvb.aspx#1)] 下面的代码示例演示如何填充对象以编程方式。The following code example demonstrates how to populate a object programmatically. 对于此示例中正常工作，你必须复制位于到名为 Book.xml 本节末尾的示例 XML 数据。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the sample XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. [!code-aspx-csharp[TreeViewCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewCtor/CS/treeviewctorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeViewCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewCtor/VB/treeviewctorvb.aspx#1)] 下面是前面的代码示例的 XML 数据。The following is the XML data for the preceding code examples. ```
```

remarks.format:
## Remarks 使用方法要追加指定到末尾的对象对象。Use the method to append the specified object to the end of the object. 作为替代方法，你可以将插入对象在在特定索引使用方法。As an alternative, you can insert a object in the at a specific index using the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法添加新对象以编程方式添加对象。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to add a new object programmatically to a object. 对于此示例中正常工作，你必须复制位于到名为 Book.xml 本节末尾的 XML 数据。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法来确定是否对象包含在对象。Use the method to determine whether a object is contained in the object. 此方法通常用于测试是否存在之前执行的任务，如添加或删除对象从集合。This method is commonly used to test for the existence of a object before performing a task, such as adding or removing a from the collection.

span.span: Copies all the items from the object to a compatible one-dimensional array of objects, starting at the specified index in the target array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法的内容复制对象插入`bindingArray`。Use the method to copy the contents of the object into `bindingArray`. 在开始复制项`index`。Items are copied starting at `index`. 然后可以使用该数组来访问集合中的项。You can then use the array to access the items that are in the collection. 作为替代方法，你可以使用方法来创建用于访问集合中的项的枚举。As an alternative, you can use the method to create an enumerator that can be used to access the items in the collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法的内容复制到一个数组的集合。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to copy the contents of the collection to an array. ## Remarks 使用索引器以访问对象对象位于`i`使用数组表示法。Use the indexer to access a object from the object located at `i` using array notation. 索引器允许你修改或替换直接集合中的对象。The indexer allows you to modify or replace a object in the collection directly. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用索引器以访问中的项对象。The following code example demonstrates how to use the indexer to access the items that are in a object. 使用新值以编程方式更新的第三级节点对象。The object for the third-level nodes is updated programmatically with new values. 对于此示例中正常工作，你必须复制位于到名为 Book.xml 本节末尾的 XML 数据。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. span.span: The to remove.

summary.span: 从 对象中移除指定的 对象。

span.span: Removes the specified object from the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 使用方法来删除指定从集合的对象。Use the method to remove the specified object from the collection. 然后按照该节点的所有项都将上都移以填充空出的位置。All items that follow that node are then moved up to fill the vacant position. 移动项的索引也将更新。The indexes of the moved items are also updated. 作为替代方法，你可以删除位于特定索引使用节点方法。As an alternative, you can remove a node at a specific index using the method. 您还可以删除每个节点在集合中使用方法。You can also remove every node in the collection using the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法移除对象以编程方式从对象。The following code example demonstrates how to use the method to remove a object programmatically from a object. 对于此示例中正常工作，你必须复制位于到名为 Book.xml 本节末尾的 XML 数据。For this example to work correctly, you must copy the XML data that is located at the end of this section to a file called Book.xml. [!code-aspx-csharp[TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd/CS/treenodebindingcollectionaddcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeBindingCollectionAdd/VB/treenodebindingcollectionaddvb.aspx#1)] 下面是前面的代码示例的 XML 数据。The following is the XML data for the preceding code example. ```
```
